oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Signature of William Turley as a prisoner-of-war
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Signature of William Turley clipped from a Johnson's Island Prisoner of War autograph book. William H. Turley was a citizen of Knox County and a railroad conductor who secured a pass in 1863 from Confederate authorities to travel North en route to Europe in order to purchase a steamer for blockade running. He was arrested in New York City and incarcarated at Johnson's Island by order of General Burnside. After the war, he was a farmer and real estate dealer in Knoxville.
